question: I have a cool idea for THAT.us, where can I submit it?
answer: THAT.us is a fully open source project located on GitHub. Feel free to add a feature request or send your idea directly to hello@thatconference.com. We are accepting pull requests too!

question: I don't see my question here, how do I get my question answered?
answer: Click the chat bubble at the bottom of the page to speak with us, join one of Clark's Open Office Hour Activities, or send an email to hello@thatconference.com. We look forward to hearing from you!

question: What is an activity?
answer: Activities are scheduled gatherings you and others create for a multitude of reasons. The format of an activity is simple, a video call in the browser with no tools required. Every Activity has a chat window, you're able to share your desktop; your webcam and microphone are enabled.

question: How do I know what activities are happening?
answer: THAT Board is the central place for ALL activities happening. Their is also an iCal feed available for you to add to your personal calendar too.

question: How do I join an activity?
answer: The most direct way to join an activity is to click the join button of the activity on THAT Board. For more details on joining activities visit this help page.

question: What makes a good activity?
answer: Almost anything makes a good Activity. A few examples are: Presentations, code reviews, Q & A sessions, panel discussion, AMA's, get a group together to figure out an issue, office hours, open space, or just to chat. You decide on the subject. Remember it must conform to our Terms of Use and Anti-Harassment policies.

question: Who can add new activities?
answer: Anybody! Anybody with a public THAT account that is. As long as you have a THAT account and make it public, so others can see who you are, you can add an Activity to THAT.us. And ensure you follow our Code of Conduct

question: How do I create an activity?
answer: Creating an activity is easy and straight forward. Head on over to this help page which will provide you with all of the details.

question: How long is an activity?
answer: The length of an Activity is up to you. An Activity may be a short 30 minutes or last all day. We have seen 30 minute, help me figure out this issue, activities and whole weekend hackathon-type activities. It's entirely up to you and what you are trying to achieve.

question: How should I prepare for an Activity?
answer:
• Ensure your background doesn't contain any non-family friendly items. It's important to keep a safe environment for all!
  • Check that your audio and camera are working. Test at the Tech Check Activity

question: How many people can join an Activity?
answer: The platform can support a maximum of 100 people per Activity.

question: Can family members, including kids, create and/or attend Activities?
answer: Yes! Everyone is welcome to create and participate in activities. However, for those under 13 years of age, must use their parent or guardian's account with appropriate supervision.

question: Do I need an account to participate in Activities?
answer: Yes, a THAT account is required to participate in any Activity. You may create a new account and profile here (Sign up).

question: Do I have to fill out a profile?
answer: Once you setup your account using your preferred provider or email address, complete your account by filling in your profile details. Profiles are only public if you choose them to be. A public profile is required to create new Activities.

question: What is the differences between a public and private THAT Profile?
answer: A private THAT Profile is not discoverable on the internet and not shown on any THAT Conference websites. A public profile lists your profile on THAT Conference Member sections and pages and makes your profile discoverable by search engines. A public THAT Profile is required to create activities. You may join activities with a private profile.

question: Are the THATConference.com and THAT.us member accounts the same?
answer: Yes, for accounts created after January 2020. With the major website update of January 2020, new member accounts work across ALL, THAT Conference sites and applications. If you created your account after January 2020 you're all good to go! Make sure you fill out your profile so the community knows something about you!

question: Internet Explorer 11 doesn't seem to work with THAT.us
answer: Sorry, IE 11 is not supported on THAT.us.

question: Why am I unable to share my screen on macOS?
answer: This usually due to permissions. You can permit screen sharing by going to System Preferences > Security & Privacy > Screen Recording, then, select the browser you're using for THAT.us

question: Oh no, `x` doesn't work on THAT.us! How do I let you know?
answer: THAT.us is a fullly open source project located at GitHub. Please fill out an bug report in GitHub and we'll have a look at it. If it is urgent (security issue, etc.) please reach out directly to hello@thatconference.com or the chat bubble at the bottom of the page.
